news-item.title: NTN sinks 5.3%
news-item.text:
NTN Corporation (TO:6472), the 23rd largest machinery/industrial goods company by market capitalisation in the Tokyo Stock Exchange, sank JPY20.0 (or 5.3%) to close at JPY357.0. Compared with the Nikkei 225 Index which fell 488.3 points (or 3.3%) in the day, this represented a relative price change of -2.0%. This has been exacerbated by average volume of 1.1 times average. The stock fell for a third day on Friday bringing its three-day fall to JPY34.0 or 8.7%. To download our Detailed Research Report (PDF), giving comprehensive trading and background information on NTN, please click http://www.buysellsignals.com/0010517119403142182 Bearish SignalsDowntrend- The stock dropped 5.3% on high volatility today.- The stock dropped to a seven-month low.- The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) indicator of 12-day Exponential Moving Average (EMA) of 379.91 minus the 26-day EMA of 392.02 is negative 12.11 suggesting a bearish signal. Both EMA prices are falling, another bearish signal.- The price tumbled 8.2% in the last week and sank 4.8% in the last month. NoteVolume: there were 7,201,000 shares worth JPY2.6 billion (US$25.2 million) traded. Beta: the Beta of NTN stock is 1.6. A Beta greater than 1 suggests this is a high risk, high return stock with volatility greater than that of the market. - NTN is at a discount of 33.5% to its 12-month high of JPY537.0 on 16 Jan, 2014. It is also at a premium of 63.8% to the 12-month low of JPY218.0 on 04 Apr, 2013. - The present value of JPY1,000 (PV1000) invested one year ago in NTN is JPY1,378, for a capital gain of JPY378. Bullish Signals:Oversold/Bullish/Support Signals- At JPY357.0 the price is below the lower Bollinger band support of JPY363.41, indicating an upside for it to return to the band. - The stock is oversold according to the Williams % R indicator of -97.6, suggesting the price is close to its 14-day low of JPY356.0.Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Undervaluation:- Price/Sales of 0.4 [2.4]. We estimate NTN stock is trading at a current year Price/Sales of 0.3 and a forward year Price/Sales of 0.3. - Price to Book of 0.9 [4.2].Other Bullish Signals:- The company is cash rich with Cash to Market Capitalisation at 27.8%. - Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 0.2. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued and ranks in the top quartile of stock by value of Q Ratio.- Revenue growth has shown signs of recovery in recent quarters.[Quarter ended, all figures in %] - Return on Capital Employed is negative but improving in recent years.[Year ended, all figures in %]
